body:
I think this line doesn't have to be changed.
Trailing spaces are not good, but a patch must only include the things concerned with the patch itself.
Please remove this change.

This line too.
lib/Subway.js doesn't need to be changed.
Please exclude 'lib/subway.js' in the commit.

Hi, thanks for the prompt replies. I have updated my commits as per
your suggestions. To keep the history clean, the commit ids are
changed, so they will look like fresh commits.

On 12:37 -0700 / 30 Sep, HyeonJe, Jun wrote:

> > @@ -79,7 +80,7 @@ var IRCLink = function(hostname, port, ssl, selfSigned, nick, realName, password
> >        for (var i = 0; i < instance.sockets.length; i++) {
> >            instance.sockets[i].emit(event, args);
> > 
> > ##        }
> 
> I think this line doesn't have to be changed.
> Trailing spaces are not good, but a patch must only include the things concerned with the patch itself.
> Please remove this change.
> 
> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/thedjpetersen/subway/pull/170/files#r1724964
Please declare `new_position` first i.e. `var new_position`
please use `===` and on the line above
good point I didn't noticed the `,`
Is there a place that you remove this class?

At the end of every [keyUp](https://github.com/SpenserJ/subway/blob/600123bcdf5b5e8914a0c02fbf7611a15891dedb/assets/js/views/chat.js#L165) we trigger [$('#chat-input').change(), ](https://github.com/SpenserJ/subway/blob/600123bcdf5b5e8914a0c02fbf7611a15891dedb/assets/js/views/chat.js#L71) which enables or disables the input based on whether there is actually content. Although I just noticed that this should call $('#chat-input').change() as well, so that so that all of the enable/disable code is in a single location.
Just the same style comment: `===`, and maybe a comment on what this comparison is doing then it looks good
Don't add whitespace here.
We should stil require a server here, if there is a default specified maybe use a checkbox or something to indicate it.
Indentation here and on the next line.
`===` coding style

In fact, "default" is the trick i use to overcome the form validation, but we can make overloading of server with a different server value.
This will work until we have a mandatory default_ircserver in config.js.
Do you need this function or could the underscore escape function work? http://underscorejs.org/#escape
Could this be bound in a method that gets bound to the 'forMe' event?
Feels a little janky inside a huge if statement
please use `===` - also I am not quite sure why you check `undefined`?

just use the backbone getter - its more idiomatic

```
msg.collection.channel.get("name")
```

What would be the best place to do so? I started doing this in ChatApplicationView, because more is bound there, but how do I access the message there? Should I create a new event for this, and send the message with it?
Undefined check is to make sure if there is no webkitHidden support, the message always shows instead of never.
Never used backbone before, thanks for the tip.

I would rather this be:

```
PORT = #{port} || document.location.port
```

That way you can just set the `client_port` to null and it will fallback to use the port of the document

I disagree since we always bind the socket.io server to the port where we serve the files, thus `client_ports` is actually redundant after this change.

What do you think?
If this is the case then the pull request should remove `client_port` as well from `webserver.js`
Agreed. Let me look out for more clean-up opportunities and the nupdate the PR.
Let's keep this convention - it's used other places in the project and I would like to keep the consistency.
